text: as many afghans try to escape from the
country one long-standing sanctuary has
been neighboring pakistan the taliban is
now fully in control of the afghan side
of the two border crossings after a few
days of disruption though trade and
people are starting to cross again bbc
urdu's sarah ateek reports on the
situation at the torkam crossing in the
northwest of pakistan
i'm at pakistan afghanistan
border whose control has been taken over
by taliban just two days back behind me
you can see the taliban fighters holding
guns
and who have taken control of the border
security when the border control was
taken over by taliban it was sealed
briefly but it was later on open for
trade and pedestrian crossing the
security officials have told me that
since the situation in afghanistan
deteriorated they have increased the
vetting procedures of those coming into
pakistan so that is why the vetting
process is taking longer and that's why
we see the queue of people waiting here
to enter into pakistan the situation at
the border seems a bit tense and the
border security officials are not
allowing us to speak to anyone who is
coming from afghanistan or leaving
pakistan but we have seen that no afghan
citizens are interacting with the
taliban fighters they are quietly
standing at a safe distance uh while
last week back when we visited
it was under the control of one national
security forces and the tension was high
even the uh of our national security
forces got really angry at the
journalists who were taking their
pictures and making videos this storkham
water has been the main point of
refugees in flux into pakistan
one of the reason that refugees used to
come
from this side of the border was because
of the fact that there was nobody post
or fans here in the past but since 2016
most of the pakistan afghanistan water
has been fenced and most of the
checkpoints have been manned which is
why the point of entry of
refugees has been reduced greatly i've
been told that taliban have imposed
tariff and taxes as well and they are
collecting taxes uh on the goods and the
trucks that uh cross from this border
and also the traders here tell me that
the computerized system was taken care
by the government officials and the
taliban do not know how to run it but
i've been told that the taliban have
asked the people who usually operate the
custom to return to work and carry on
their duties as normal
